content: @WG-triage meeting time
thank you for your triage work, i don't think there's much progress on the dashboard

uhm so github made some changes and for new contributors, you need a member to run the workflow for them (to prevent mining etc). If you see such prs and you can't start the workflow (not sure what permissions you have) kindly add them to the report so I can take a look at those
I think the WG has write permissions (on rustc-lang/rust), so members can approve workflows
indeed!
ye i woudln't be surprised just that permissions are confusing given number of groups and different settings
yeah if you can start the workflow, that would be good

in the past i did mention that I would like to reconsider if we need to change the meeting time. Looking at the options, I feel it'sbetter to stick to the same time since I don't see a timing where all of us are available
i'll stick to the same slot for the next few months. We could reconsider it in september or october once summer time ends
thtat's it from me, anyone has anything to add?
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.

FYI: Lots of PRs as old as 24 days waiting on reviewer - concerned about triage load being overwhelming.

Also: a lot of them belong to estebank.
I'm sorry. i skipped s-waiting-on-review prs twice recently. Been a little busy.

John Simon said:

FYI: Lots of PRs as old as 24 days waiting on reviewer - concerned about triage load being overwhelming.

Also: a lot of them belong to estebank.

yeah i did see those in the report
i'll wait for a week and see if i can re-assign those or get them moving

Charles Lew said:

I'm sorry. i skipped s-waiting-on-review prs twice recently. Been a little busy.

yeah that's fine not an issue. If you miss, another person triaging will pick it up so not a concern
oky, that's it for this month. The next meeting will be on 2021-08-04T18:00:00+02:00
see ya and stay safe :smile:
